content: Does evolution intentionally plan specific adaptations to improve an organism's fitness to survive?

Evolution does not have a purpose or intention behind it. It is a natural process that occurs over time due to changes in genetic variation and environmental pressures. Adaptations that improve an organism's fitness to survive are simply those that are more likely to be passed on to future generations through natural selection. There is no predetermined plan or goal for evolution; it is a continuous process that shapes the diversity of life on Earth.
